util
Class DatagramWanEmulator

java.lang.Object
  util.DatagramWanEmulator

public class DatagramWanEmulator
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class for debugging UDP communication. The DatagramWanEmulator sits between two specified DatagramSockets and introduces latency, jitter and package loss between these two sockets.

In order to use the emulator, you send the DatagramPackets directly to the emulator's SocketAddress instead of sending them to the receiver SocketAddress. The emulator will introduce latency, jitter and package loss. Then it will send the packets to the receiving socket.

This class can be instantiated with the respective addresses. Use the appropriate methods to start and stop the emulation. The specific emulation parameters can be tuned with the appropriate getters / setters.

Author:
mucaho

Field Detail

STPE

private final java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor STPE
Internally used. Queues up delayed sending of datagram packets

socketAddress1

private final java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddress1
The socket address1.

socketAddress2

private final java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddress2
The socket address2.

emulatorSocket

private java.net.DatagramSocket emulatorSocket
The emulator socket.

maxPacketLength

private int maxPacketLength
The maximum size of incoming / outcoming datagram packets. Defaults to 1024.

packageLossPercentage

private float packageLossPercentage
The amount of package loss. A value of 0.0f means no package loss, a value of 1.0f means every packet will be lost.

maxLatency

private int maxLatency
The maximum latency between sending from one host to receiving on the other one. The latency will vary between zero and this value.

isRunning

private volatile boolean isRunning
The is running.

private java.lang.Thread runningThread
The running thread.

The runnable.

DatagramWanEmulator

public DatagramWanEmulator(java.net.InetSocketAddress emulatorAddress,
                           java.net.InetSocketAddress hostAddress1,
                           java.net.InetSocketAddress hostAddress2)
                    throws java.net.SocketException
Construct a new DatagramWanEmulator. This will automatically create a new socket bound to the specified emulatorAddress.

hostAddress1 - the host address1
hostAddress2 - the host address2
